country.name: Peru
country.overview: Peru is a country in South America that's home to a section of Amazon rainforest and Machu Picchu, an ancient Incan city high in the Andes mountains. The region around Machu Picchu, including the Sacred Valley, Inca Trail and colonial city of Cusco, is rich in archaeological sites. On Peru’s arid Pacific coast is Lima, the capital, with a preserved colonial center and important collections of pre-Columbian art.

translations.name: ပီရူးနိုင်ငံ
ประเทศเปรู

geography.location_description: Western South America, bordering the South Pacific Ocean, between Chile and Ecuador
geography.area_note: almost twice the size of Texas; slightly smaller than Alaska
geography.climate: varies from tropical in east to dry desert in west; temperate to frigid in Andes
geography.terrain: western coastal plain (costa), high and rugged Andes in center (sierra), eastern lowland jungle of Amazon Basin (selva)
geography.hazards: earthquakes, tsunamis, flooding, landslides, mild volcanic activity
geography.notes: shares control of Lago Titicaca, world's highest navigable lake, with Bolivia; a remote slope of Nevado Mismi, a 5,316 m peak, is the ultimate source of the Amazon River

languages.name: Santa Ana de Tusi Pasco Quechua
